From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To turn on power-on diagnostic tests for the network service engines (NSEs) installed in a Cisco 7300 series router, use the **diagnostic level** command in privileged EXEC configuration mode. There is no **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Power-on diagnostic tests are performed at system bootup on the NSEs.
No diagnostic tests are performed. This is the default.

Examples: The following example shows how to enable diagnostic power-on tests:
The following sample output shows the output that is displayed upon system bootup after a power cycle or router crash:
Note ! [ ] (/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)This output is displayed when the system is booting, not when the command is issued.
ExtraInfo: Use this command to enable power-on diagnostic tests to run on the installed NSEs of a Cisco 7300 series router when the system is booted. It is recommended that you issue this command only if you are experiencing problems with an NSE and are planning on rebooting the router. Issuing this command causes an increase in the boot time.

RelatedCmds.description: Displays the types of cards (NSE and line cards) installed in a Cisco 7300 series router.
Displays redundancy information for the active and standby NSEs.
